title: Nektar Therapeutics shares slide 6.3% premarket after Goldman downgrades to sell from buy
text: Nektar Therapeutics shares NKTR, -1.56% slid 6.3% in premarket trade Tuesday, after Goldman Sachs downgraded the stock to sell from buy and said the stock will likely flounder in the near term due to quality issues and a narrower focus for bempegaldesleukin, its treatment for cancer. Analysts led by Paul Choi slashed their stock price target to $16 from $54. the stock has underperformed for the last 18 months, as execution missteps outweighed announcements of mostly positive clinical developments, said the analysts. "When we initiated coverage of NKTR on Dec. 13, 2018, we expected additional data from the PIVOT-02 study of NKTR's bempegaldesleukin + BMY's Opdivo (potential treatment for a variety of advanced solid tumors) to help rebuild the investment case after investors grew bearish on the stock in the wake of deteriorating efficacy data presented at ASCO 2018 and a decreasing likelihood of industry M&A," the analysts wrote. "While the reported data since then has been somewhat encouraging, NKTR disclosed manufacturing discrepancies which resulted in suboptimal batches of bempeg being used in the PIVOT-02 and PROPEL clinical trials." The resulting investor uncertainty has pulled the stock down 60% from its Jan. 19 high and will likely remain an overhang, they wrote. Shares have fallen 42% in 2019, while the S&P 500 SPX, -0.45% has gained 17%.
